subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. upheld sanctions against Arkansas’ track program, although the university said it hoped to keep two national titles. Arkansas said it would ask an N.C.A.A. committee to clarify how many points the Razorbacks must vacate from the 2004 and 2005 men’s outdoor championships. The Razorbacks won the title both years. Arkansas was penalized for violations involving the sprinter Tyson Gay and a former assistant coach.
